item.title: T4SD (Tips 4 Spring Devs): Exposing Query Methods in Spring Data REST
item.description: Spring Data REST takes an opinionated approach to exposing Spring Data repositories via REST endpoints, covering the 80-90% use case with a minimum of code and fuss. But did you know that it provides a no-lifting-required mechanism for exposing query methods you define on those repositories as well? Let’s say you create a method like this: https://gist.github.com/hecklerm/df38b5b847e476ee35e3a6576bf31e78 Referencing that bit of functionality directly is simple, just append /search/<methodName> to the collection endpoint:
